metadata.name: Storage
metadata.description:
To access your Cloud Storage buckets, you will use the bucket function returned from this storage object.

The example below will demonstrate the different usage patterns your app may need to connect to gcloud and access your bucket.

examples.caption: From Google Compute Engine and Google App Engine.
examples.code:
// Access `storage` through the `gcloud` module directly.
var musicBucket = gcloud.storage().bucket('music');

examples.caption: Elsewhere.

metadata.name: acl
metadata.description:
Google Cloud Storage uses access control lists (ACLs) to manage object and bucket access. ACLs are the mechanism you use to share objects with other users and allow other users to access your buckets and objects.

This object provides constants to refer to the three permission levels that can be granted to a scope:

  • Storage.acl.OWNER_ROLE - ("OWNER")
  • Storage.acl.READER_ROLE - ("READER")
  • Storage.acl.WRITER_ROLE - ("WRITER")

For more detailed information, see About Access Control Lists.

metadata.name: bucket
metadata.description: Get a reference to a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

params.name: name
params.description: - Name of the bucket to create.

params.name: metadata
params.description: - Metadata to set for the bucket.

exceptions.description: If a name is not provided.

metadata.name: getBuckets
metadata.description: Get Bucket objects for all of the buckets in your project.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: - Maximum number of items plus prefixes to return.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: - A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.
